p: Another way for the virus to cross the barrier is to be carried by an infected blood cell. However, SARS-CoV-2, if able to enter into PBMCs does not seem to be replicative in these cells, like SARS-CoV-1 [ 24]. On the other hand, the resident macrophages of the lymph nodes or the spleen would express the ACE2 receptor (ACE2 +, CD169 + or CD68 + cells) and in terminally ill patients, the virus is found in these cells (Immunohistochemistry, nucleocapsid) but not in T or B lymphocytes [ 25]. SARS-CoV-1, which also uses the ACE2 receptor, is also found in alveolar macrophages [ 26].
